body_html:
I was not sure if people from outside the project should be invited to just fix an existing issue without getting further involved with the project (I'd see it as the 3rd way of contributing after bug reports and feature requests).
If so, a Resolving an existing issue section could be helpful / save some time. I added one in 065de18 - feel free to remove the commit if that part of the guide was not planned to exist.
body_text:
I was not sure if people from outside the project should be invited to just fix an existing issue without getting further involved with the project (I'd see it as the 3rd way of contributing after bug reports and feature requests).
If so, a Resolving an existing issue section could be helpful / save some time. I added one in 065de18 - feel free to remove the commit if that part of the guide was not planned to exist.
body:
I was not sure if people from outside the project should be **invited** to _just_ fix an existing issue without getting further involved with the project _(I'd see it as the 3rd way of contributing after bug reports and feature requests)_.
If so, a **`Resolving an existing issue`** section could be helpful / save some time. I added one in 065de181898fa26f5b00479a72e86b8fce731ef3 - feel free to remove the commit if that part of the guide was not planned to exist.
